thread.section_title: People At Orange County Jewish Center Evacuated Due To ‘Unknown Type Threat’ – CBS Los Angeles
thread.title: People At Orange County Jewish Center Evacuated Due To ‘Unknown Type Threat’
thread.title_full: People At Orange County Jewish Center Evacuated Due To ‘Unknown Type Threat’

author: N. Liang
title: People At Orange County Jewish Center Evacuated Due To ‘Unknown Type Threat’
text:
IRVINE (CBSLA.com) — About 1,000 people from a Jewish community center were evacuated Monday because of an “unknown type Threat,” Irvine police said.
The Merage Jewish Community Center of Orange County is located at 1 Federation Way.
The threat also forced the closure of the Westside Jewish Center in the Mid-Wilshire area in Los Angeles.
#Threat forces closure tonight of #Westside #JCC . #traffic trouble on surrounding streets. #Olympic @KNX1070 @CBSLA 
— Vicky Moore (@KNXVickyMoore) February 28, 2017
